paragraph.heading: 2Compiling
paragraph.paragraph:
To compile the example:
Start Visual Studio .NET
Choose Open Project from the File menu.
Navigate to <EiffelEnvision_installation_path>\compiler\examples\(.net version)\winforms\world_calc and select world_calc.eifp
Clicking open loads the selected project
Launch EiffelStudio.
Select Use existing Ace (control file) and click OK
Browse to $ISE_EIFFEL\examples\dotnet\winforms\applications\world_calc
Choose the Ace file for the version of the .net framework you are running
Choose the directory where the project will be compiled, by default the same directory containing the Ace file.
Click OK.
paragraph.heading: 2Running
paragraph.paragraph: After launching the application, you will see a window displayed with a similar appearance to the one above. This is a really simple calculator that can take only two operands. So you should enter the first operand, then enter an operator, then the second operand. Click the "Calculate" button to generate the result.
paragraph.heading: 2Under the Hood
paragraph.paragraph: The application uses two local external assemblies, math.dll and parserutils.dll.
parserutils parses the command line entered, and checks if it is of the form operand1 operator operand2. math.dll calculates the actual result of the command line.
For the parserutils.dll, we have been obliged to introduce the prefix "parser_" to avoid conflicts between name classes.
